html:
Goodbye Siri and thanks for all the fish

Some weak mixed metaphors in the wake of the ripples of Apple’s Liquid Glass

Tonnes of real and digital ink have been spilled after Apple’s recently concluded Worldwide Developer’s Conference (WWDC) 25. In short: Apple product launch generates much hype. Plus ça change, plus c’est la même chose. The more things change, the more they remain the same. However, it is not, for once, a device that is catching all the attention — it is a “design language”.

UX is now the core differentiator of the Apple brand

So, Liquid Gas…er.. Glass..

Not to blow our own horns as UX people but, gosh this is humbling, I hadn’t really prepared a speech but… we are the Masters of Everything now! I’d like to thank my mother and father, my teachers, my wife and my agent, Siri, who always believed in me…

By placing smooth user journeys across its platforms at the heart of the brand, Apple has made explicit that user experience is the main differentiator from its competition. It kinda felt super trite to type that out. An exercise in the obvious.

A ruthlessly minimalistic form of Glassmorphism goes from trend to a core pillar of design. Only now it shimmers, shines and moves around like a see…
